text: Fiji and Georgia played four times, out of which Fiji won three games and Georgia one. ==Summary== ===Overall=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !width="125"| Details !width="125"| Played !width="125"| Won by !width="125"| Won by !width="125"| Drawn !width="125"| Fiji points !width="125"| Georgia points |- | In Fiji | 2 | 1 | 1 | 0 | 40 | 29 |- | In Georgia | 1 | 1 | 0 | 0 | 24 | 19 |- | Neutral venue | 1 | 1 | 0 | 0 | 45 | 10 |- | Overall | 4 | 3 | 1 | 0 | 109 | 58 |} ===Records=== Note: Date shown in brackets indicates when the record was or last set. {| class="wikitable" |- !Record !Fiji !Georgia |- |Longest winning streak |2 (16 June 2018–Present) |1 (24 June 2016–16 June 2018) |- !colspan=3 align=center|Largest points for |- |Home |37 (16 June 2018) |19 (24 November 2012) |- |Away |45 (3 October 2019) |15 (16 June 2018) |- !colspan=3 align=center|Largest winning margin |- |Home |22 (16 June 2018) |N/A |- |Away |35 (3 October 2019) |11 (24 June 2016) |} ==Results== {| class="wikitable" |- ! No. ! Date ! Venue ! Score ! Winner ! Competition |- ! 1 | 24 November 2012 | Mikheil Meskhi Stadium, Tbilisi | align="center"| 19 - 24 | | 2012 end-of-year rugby union internationals |- ! 2 | 24 June 2016 | ANZ National Stadium, Suva | align="center"| 3 - 14 | | 2016 mid-year rugby union internationals |- ! 3 | 16 June 2018 | ANZ National Stadium, Suva | align="center"| 37 - 15 | | 2018 World Rugby Pacific Nations Cup |- ! 4 | 3 October 2019 | Hanazono Rugby Stadium, Higashiosaka, Japan | align="center"| 10 - 45 | | 2019 Rugby World Cup |} ==References== Category:Fiji national rugby union team matches Category:Georgia national rugby union team matches
